item.title: Extend class8.java to class8_sub1.java
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:6, topic:306545”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=402704.msg2983590#msg2983590 date=1254785392]
Good job, looks good.

why?

Because im getting ready to start converting my client to look 565, so i will NEED this in order to make it correct.

So, you gonna have new animations?
They are crucial.

[/quote]

Eeh, im gonna do what i can. So far im doing all weapons. Then shields. Its the ints im having a problem with. The scimitars are not re-coloring.[/quote]

Ah, I see, I’m guessing you already got the character models?
Recolouring is because the datmaker changes the colours very slightly after converting manually animated weapons, I presume you manually animated the weapons due to a lot of them from the new cache having corrupt animation data?
So because of this, the ints contained within the cache will not work because the colour IDs of the model are different.

Easiest way would be to edit the cache and change the colours that the cache changes on the model, or there’s always the good old method of hardcoding it all into your class8.

And with this tutorial, it makes the 2nd option a lot more efficient.

Read full topic

item.title: Extend class8.java to class8_sub1.java
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[size=28pt]DONT JUST LEECH, COMMENT PLEASE[/size]

Alright, what i have made out of this, is to make class8.java accept another files ints. First, in class8.java. Make ALL ints be public instead of private. Basicaly use the ctrl+h feature and find Private Int and replace that with Public int

Second, declare this at the END of your ints in class8.java.

Class8_Sub1.items(i);

Now, make a new file called Class8_Sub1.java and put this inside of it

/*	This was made by CoonHunter of moparscape,  Or Kenshin1388 of rune server.
 *	
 *	What this will do is extend your items to not only be in class8.java but also use clas8_sub1.java
 *	for items as well. I believe this will fix the "method too large" error in most clients.
 *	
 *	I only tested this in my client, so i have NO garentee this will work in yours.
 */

import sign.signlink;
import java.io.*;


final class Class8_Sub1 {
public static void items(int i) {
Class8 c = Class8.method198(i);
switch(i) {

}//ends switch
}//ends void
}//ends file

Tell me how it works.

EDIT - I used this myself so, dont tell me “this wont work” because i used the item in-game.

Read full topic
